DataElement.preferredName: Disease Status Or Newly Diagnosed Disease or Disorder Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol that address the assessments of disease status or newly diagnosed disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Status Or Newly Diagnosed Disease or Disorder Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Very recently determined._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has PHEO/PGL, is d
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has PHEO/PGL, is disease recurrent or progressive or patient is newly diagnosed with PHEO/PGL that is metastatic at diagnosis and/or unresectable?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have suspected refractory or relapsed pre-B cell ALL or mixed phenotype acute leukemia (MPAL), or if newly diagnosed, is patient 60 years of age or older?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have diagnosis of AML, MDS or CMML, according to local laboratory review, classified by the 2016 WHO criteria (Arber et al., 2016) (with the exception of acute promyelocytic leukemia [APL] or AML with a t[15;17][q22;q12] cytogenic abnormality)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have diagnosis of AML, MDS or CMML, according to local laboratory review, classified by the 2016 WHO criteria (Arber et al., 2016) (with the exception of acute promyelocytic leukemia [APL] or AML with a t[15;17][q22;q12] cytogenetic abnormality)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have diagnosis of MDS or AML per World Health Organization 2016 classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been diagnosed with Stage IV colorectal cancer (CRC), Stage III/IV non-small cell (NSCL) or small cell lung cancer (SCLC), metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (PCA), Stage IV gastroesophageal cancer (GEC), Stage III/IV melanoma (MEL), or treatment refractory multiple myeloma (MML)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has newly diagnosed, unresectable, metastatic and measurable clear cell sarcoma, EWSR1/ATF1 or EWSR1/CREB1 translocation, grade 2 or 3 conventional chondrosarcoma, or dedifferentiated chondrosarcoma, does patient show clinical evidence of disease progression (including history and increasing physical symptoms)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a newly diagnosed primary and/or metastatic solid tumor, lymphoma or multiple myeloma malignancy, are they treatment naïve for this malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed and pathologically confirmed AML, confirmed by a bone marrow aspirate and/or biopsy and/or peripheral blood with greater than or equal to 20% myeloid blasts?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's clinical presentation consistent with, or has the patient been diagnosed with one of the following:  Stage IV colorectal cancer (CRC), Stage III/IV non-small cell (NSCL) OR small cell lung cancer (SCLC), metastatic prostate cancer (PCA), Stage IV gastroesophageal cancer (GEC), Stage III/IV melanoma (MEL), acute myeloid leukemia or multiple myeloma (MML)?
